@graph.headline: Create Custom DIY Extract Wrangles in Excel
@graph.description: Build customized extract wrangles using pattern matching or AI to identify structured information from unstructured Excel data.

@graph.name: How to Build a DIY Extract Wrangle

step.name: Create a Pattern Matching Extract Wrangle
step.text: Navigate to the Extract tab under My Wrangles, click the '+' icon, and enter training data in the Train-Extract sheet.

step.name: Train Your Wrangle
step.text: Fill in the Find, Output (Optional), and Notes columns. Submit to save the wrangle.

step.name: Edit or Update Wrangles
step.text: Click the three dots next to a wrangle to edit. Changes are saved upon resubmission.

step.name: Use AI Extract Wrangles
step.text: Select the AI model, define your columns with Find and Description, and provide optional schema or examples.

step.name: Configure Output Settings
step.text: Customize how extract results are formatted using JSON, columns, delimited strings, or raw matches.

@graph.name: Pattern and AI Extract Types
@graph.description: UI section showing the two DIY extract types: Pattern Matching and AI.

@graph.name: MRO Brand Extract Example
@graph.description: Demonstrates extraction of brand names using a pattern match wrangle.

@graph.name: Train Extract Sheet
@graph.description: Sheet interface where training data for extract wrangles is entered.

@graph.name: Edit Extract Wrangle
@graph.description: Edit interface for updating an existing extract wrangle.

@graph.name: Train AI Extract Wrangle
@graph.description: UI for training an AI-based extract wrangle with schema definitions.

@graph.name: Custom Extract Settings
@graph.description: Settings panel for configuring output options in extract wrangles.

@graph.headline: Extract Functions in Wrangles for Python
@graph.description: Functions to extract structured data from unstructured text using Wrangles Python library, including address, AI, properties, and more.

@graph.name: How to Use Extract Functions in Wrangles for Python

step.name: Use extract.address
step.text: Extract structured address components like streets or countries from free-text columns using the extract.address function.

step.name: Use extract.ai
step.text: Use recipe-based or model-based AI extraction to return structured values using OpenAI models with descriptive prompts or trained schemas.

step.name: Use extract.attributes
step.text: Extract numerical attributes such as length, mass, and current from input text, with options for unit conversion and object outputs.

step.name: Use extract.codes and extract.brackets
step.text: Use specialized functions to extract values within brackets or identify alphanumeric codes from text.

step.name: Use extract.regex and extract.properties
step.text: Extract values with custom regex patterns or identify categorical attributes like colours or materials.

@graph.name: Wrangles Extract Pattern Types
@graph.description: Diagram illustrating pattern and AI-based extraction workflows.

@graph.name: Wrangles
@graph.softwareRequirements: Requires Microsoft Excel or Python 3.x environment

@graph.headline: Extract Wrangles in Excel
@graph.description: Extracts specific patterns like addresses, attributes, codes, and more from Excel columns.

@graph.name: How to Use Extract Wrangles in Excel

step.name: Choose Extract Wrangle
step.text: Select the appropriate extract wrangle for your data type (e.g., Address, Attribute, Brackets).

step.name: Configure Options
step.text: Use available options like output format, unit conversion, or bracket type.

step.name: Adjust Output Format
step.text: Use the settings button to choose output as JSON, columns, delimited text, or first element only.

@graph.name: Extract Wrangles Overview
@graph.description: Overview of extract wrangles in the Wrangles Excel interface.

@graph.name: Extract Settings
@graph.description: Settings panel for configuring extract wrangle output formatting.

@graph.text:
extract:
  attribute: length
  response_content: object
  desired_unit: mm
  significant_figures: 2
